name: places/ChIJ_-4L875ZwokRYlNvxYGqMZg
formattedAddress: 657 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 657 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: Small theaters with reclining seating. It’s what a boutique style theater would look like in this day and age perhaps. There is a bar with tables inside for patrons looking to meet up before, during, or after a film. The staff is helpful and eager to provide service. The tickets for a show or movie are higher than usual and the menu for food to dine in the theater is bigger than expected. I had chicken fingers & sweet potato fries ordered and delivered to my seat inside the theater. That worked as intended just not exciting to scan a QR code to order. It is convenient if your phone is charged up. The fingers were fresh, hot, and crispy. Pretty large size wise but the bbq sauce was no match and very tiny. The fries had a burnt taste otherwise they were okay. I visited the bar and it was a cool space, the end of night Bartending team was attentive and went above and beyond. My Tito’s mule was pretty decent. I originally wanted a lemonade cocktail and the house lemonade was off. The team remade a small batch to demonstrate how much better it usually is at the bar. Wasn’t expecting that. Each bar seat has an outlet for charging. Great feature!

originalText.text: 01/ 13/23 Nice theater. I didn't go to the bar but I liked the decor . I went to go see mean girls with my friend Even though it's a stylish looking theater it still has a lot to to do to be a better business, the movie volume would stop working throughout the whole movie also my food and drink came towards the end of the movie and I would have to ask  a server passing by to get even something simple as a napkin that person did come back though and  Gave me the things I asked for but I used the call bell on the app and I didn't get a response. No one came. There needs to be a lot more than just a stylish movie. Theater is also working on customer service but I can't discredit the supervisor or manager at the end that I wasn't the only one that went to complain about what was going on and I could only imagine if anybody else had to deal with late services. Well but I digress. The supervisor or management was very nice. She generally seem like she understood from all the guest point of view. She apologized. She let everyone talk and then she would say something and she pretty much gave us refunds which was appreciated. So I give this theater a three but it has potential to be as good or even better than AMC . I used to work there and there are a lot of errors that AMC has had and hasn't fix them and not just their dine-in theaters. Regular theaters too. So if look at least for this location I can't say for all locations has the potential to be better. So I will go again to watch furiosa when it  comes out in May Also I'm still waiting on the refund but will update this review just in case

originalText.text: My family and I had a great experience at the LOOK theatre on Mon, Jan 15. The staff were super helpful and attentive. Theater was clean when we arrived. Food was served in a timely manner and was fresh/warm. I asked about the popcorn I ordered and the waitress not only delivered it promptly she was also very friendly! I felt well looked after and welcome. For a holiday, there was ample staff in the theatre. Better experience than the AMC theatres!

originalText.text: The service was amazing that atmosphere was nice and clean. But the kitchen is very slow and serving food. I ordered my food before the movie start I didn't receive it to 45 minutes to an hour later and it was cold. I highly recommend when you buy your tickets at the door order your food during the same time and hopefully it arrive before the movie start. I give the staff five stars but I give the kitchen zero stars. The staff and the kitchen are very slow. I would go back but I wouldn't order food I'll eat before I go. I wouldn't recommend it. If you want to eat in a dine-in theater go over to New Jersey. Sad to say because you're in New York you can't expect anything better.

originalText.text: I went to Look Dine-In for the first time0 yesterday. The experience was quite pleasant. The seats were small, but comfortable and the ticket prices are reasonable.  Friendly staff. My only piece of feedback is to try and come up with a system that makes the concession delivery less distracting. It may also help to have an option to pay for food that isn't digital.  Some customers may not have smart phones. Otherwise an overall decent experience.
